Question: What should I do if my order is approved but hasn't been shipped yet?
Answer: Sellers usually ship orders 1-2 business days before the delivery date so that they reach you on time. In case your order hasn't been shipped within this time please contact our Customer Support so that we can look into it.

Question: Can I take the shipment after opening and checking the contents inside?
Answer: As per company policy, a shipment can't be opened before delivery, but you can accept the shipment and get in touch with us later in case you have any concerns.

Question: How quickly can I get my order delivered?
Answer: Orders will be delivered by the date you see on the product page for your location.

Question: What are the standard shipping speeds and delivery charges?
Answer: Standard Delivery charges and shipping timelines vary based on several factors like the seller, type of the product, price of the product, order value and delivery pin code. Delivery timeline is displayed on the product page. You can choose a delivery pin code on the product page and it will display the list of sellers who cater to that location and the applicable shipping charges.

Question: When will I get my order once its status changes to 'Out for Delivery'?
Answer: Once an order is out for delivery, please wait till 11 PM for the delivery executive to deliver your order. For products that have a faster delivery option to your location, the time by which it can be delivered will be mentioned on the product page.

Question: Why am I unable to order products like television, air-conditioner, refrigerator, washing machine, furniture, microwave, treadmill, etc. at my location?

The delivery of large category products at a particular location depends on the following factors:
Dimensions and weight
Location of the seller
Serviceability of the seller's partnered service provider

Question: Are faster delivery options like Same Day & In-a-Day available on return requests?

Question: What should I do if I find the package open or tampered on delivery?
Answer: You can reject the delivery at the doorstep. However, if the product is already delivered, you can create a return request for the item as per the returns policy from the 'Orders' section of your app.

Question: Why did the delivery executive refuse to pickup my product?
Answer: When returning a product, it is important to select the correct reason for the return and ensure that the item being returned meets the criteria for the selected reason code. This is because delivery executives are responsible for performing checks on the returned product and will refuse to pick up the item if it does not meet the specified criteria. If this happens, it is advisable to ask the delivery executive for the reason for the pickup denial to avoid similar incidents in the future. By following these guidelines, you can help ensure a smoother return process and minimise the chances of your return being rejected.

Question: Can my order be prioritised or delivered faster?
Answer: Order delivery dates can't be changed, since they're determined by sellers based on the timeline they need for processing. These are based on factors like your address, the seller's address and the type of product. That said, orders usually arrive on or before the scheduled delivery date, and you can track them easily via our app or website.

Question: The delivery of my order is delayed. What should I do?
Answer: In the event that the delivery of your order is delayed, a new delivery date will be communicated to you via SMS/email. Additionally, you can access your Flipkart app's 'Orders' section to view the new delivery date and order status.

Question: My order status is delivered but I have not got the package, what do I do?
Answer:
- See if any of your neighbours/friends/relatives/house owners/security guards have collected your product on your behalf.
- Wait until the end of the day— sometimes packages can reflect delivered while still in transit.
In the unlikely event of you still not being able to locate your item, please contact us and we will be happy to help.

Question: How do I track my order details?

Question: Can I collect the product from warehouse/hub?

As a security measure, orders cannot be picked up from a warehouse, hub, or delivery center. Instead, orders will be delivered to the address provided by the customer.

Question: How can I check which address I provided, and confirm if the billing address is the same as the shipping address?

Question: Why is my order status not updated to delivered ?

Question: Why did I receive a message about delivery failure when I already received my order?

Question: When will I get my order once it is Out for Delivery?

Question: When will I get my order if I miss a delivery attempt?
Answer: If you miss a delivery, another attempt is made on the next business day, and an SMS is sent with details about the revised delivery date. An order is usually cancelled after three unsuccessful delivery attempts have been made.

Question: My order has reached the nearest delivery hub, but why isn't it out for delivery yet?
Answer: The delivery partner delivering your order is responsible for making sure that your order reaches you within the delivery date. Rest assured, you'll get an SMS once your shipment is out for delivery. You can also contact the delivery executive using the contact details available on the 'Orders' page.

Question: Why does the estimated delivery time vary for each seller?
Answer: Delivery timelines are determined by various factors, including the type of product, the seller's city, your delivery location, and the time needed by the delivery partner to deliver the order. You can view the estimated delivery time by entering your pincode on the product page.

Question: I have a complaint about the delivery executive who came to deliver my order.

Question: Why can't I track my order even though it has been shipped?

Question: Why was my order not delivered/delivery attempt unsuccessful?
Answer:
Sometimes, an order may be undelivered due to one of the following reasons:
Incorrect Address: If the address is incorrect or outdated, the package is usually returned to the seller by the delivery partner or the unintended recipient.
Other Address Issues: In rare cases, it is also possible that the address label was difficult to decipher during the shipping and handling process, or that the delivery partner left the package at a different address than what was printed on the label.
Failed Delivery Attempts: Most of the delivery partners make more than one attempt to deliver a package. If nobody is available to accept the delivery after multiple attempts, the package is returned to the seller. Please keep your phone handy to ensure the delivery executive can contact you once the order is out for delivery.
Damaged During Transit: If a package is damaged on its way to you, the delivery partner will return it to the seller without attempting delivery.
Logistical issues: Unexpected issues like heavy rain, vehicle breakdown, or government restrictions in an area
Rest assured, delivery partners will make a total of 3 attempts to deliver your order.

Question: What do the different order statuses in 'My Orders' mean?
Answer:
The different order statuses are as mentioned below:
Approved: Order you have placed for an item is confirmed by the seller.
Ready to Ship: Your item is packed and ready for pickup by a delivery partner.
Dispatched: Your item has been picked up from the seller by the delivery partner and is on its way to a logistic facility.
Shipped: Your item is on its way to you.
Out for delivery: A delivery executive is out to deliver your order.
Delivered: Your item has been delivered.
Return requested: You have created a return request for the item, which is pending confirmation from the seller.
Returned: You have returned the item for refund/replacement/exchange.

Question: Can I club my orders from different sellers to be delivered together?

Question: Will the delivery be tried again if I'm not able to collect my order the first time?

Question: Why are faster delivery options not available at my location?

Question: Why did I receive a new delivery date for my order on the day my order was initially supposed to be delivered?

Question: What are the factors that affect my Cibil score?
Answer:
Your Cibil score can be affected due to any of the below reasons:

1) Payment History
A regular payment history indicates that you are a responsible borrower. Hence, ensure that you do not default on any payments.
2) Credit Utilization Ratio
The credit utilization ratio is the amount of credit you use from the total credit limit you have. Experts advise that you keep your credit utilization at 30% to ensure a good credit score.
3) Credit Mix
Having multiple credit accounts, such as a home loan, personal loan, and credit card show lenders that you can manage multiple types of debt at the same time. The more credit types you have, the better (as long as you pay on time).
4) Multiple enquiries on your credit
If your credit report shows a lot of hard enquiries in the recent past, it will have a negative effect on your credit score. Multiple hard enquiries mean that you are desperate for credit, which makes you a bad risk.
5) Length of your credit history
When you have a long credit history, the creditors are assured that you are good at managing your debt and that has a positive impact on your credit score. Closing down old credit accounts will decrease your credit score.

Question: How can I upgrade to full KYC?
Answer:
If you are a minimum KYC user, you can always upgrade to full KYC by following these simple steps:
- Tap 'Flipkart Pay Later' under ‘Credit Options’
- Tap ‘View Details’ option across 'Paylater Credit'
- Tap ‘Apply Now’
- Enter Your PAN and Aadhaar Number
- Verify the Aadhaar Number using OTP sent to mobile
- Tap ‘Submit’

Question: What is the process for completing full KYC?
Answer: To complete your full KYC, we will search your KYC details on the Central KYC Registry. In case your central KYC record does not exist, you would need to undergo a video - KYC. Once successful, you will be required to provide your bank account details (Account no. & IFSC code). We will then proceed to deposit Rs 1/- into your account to verify your account name against your PAN/Aadhaar.In order to upgrade your KYC smoothly, please ensure that the account number shared by you is active and is registered in your name.

Question: What is the Central KYC Registry?
Answer: The Central KYC (C-KYC) Registry is an initiative by the government of India to centralize the KYC documents of the customers for availing various financial services. The purpose of C-KYC is to remove the need for submitting fresh documents for KYC verification every time a new financial relationship needs to be started.

Question: What is Aadhaar Paperless Offline e-KYC?
Answer: Aadhaar Paperless Offline e-KYC is another mode for upgrading to full KYC. Only users who do not have a C-KYC record will need to go through this. As part of the process, you will be redirected to the UIDAI website to generate your Aadhaar Paperless Offline e-KYC which will be shared with our lending partner in a secured manner.

Question: Is my KYC/account information shared with partners?
Answer:
KYC is conducted by our financial partner, hence your KYC details and bank account details captured in the onboarding journey are shared with the lending partners as per extant guidelines.
For more information regarding Flipkart’s data privacy policy, please visit the following link - https://www.flipkart.com/pages/fapl-privacy-policy

Question: How can I place an order using Flipkart EMI on Flipkart?
Answer:
Here's how you can place an order:
- Add item(s) to your cart as usual
- Proceed to checkout
- Select Flipkart EMI as your payment mode, and select an EMI plan as per your preference.
Please note, you may need an OTP to complete your transaction. This is an additional verification required as an enhanced security measure for certain transactions only.

Question: How can I place an order using Flipkart EMI on platforms other than Flipkart?
Answer: Currently, Flipkart EMI is not available on platforms other than Flipkart.

Question: Do I need to make a down payment to buy an item using Flipkart EMI facility?
Answer: No, you can place orders without making any down payment.

Question: What rate of interest will be incurred while availing Flipkart EMI?
Answer: The interest rate and the actual interest amount to be paid will be visible on the payments page when you are selecting your EMI plan to place an order.

Question: How can I track my Flipkart EMI usage and transactions?
Answer:
Here's how you can track your Flipkart EMI usage and transactions:
- Log in to your Flipkart account
- Go to 'Account'
- Visit the 'Flipkart EMI' section
- Tap 'view usage'

Question: Do I get an OTP while paying through Flipkart EMI?
Answer: Yes, you may receive an OTP on your registered mobile number which you would need to enter to authorise the transaction.

Question: Can I cancel/return my order after I've placed it using Flipkart EMI?
Answer: Yes, you can cancel/return a product by visiting the 'Orders' section and choosing the item you wish to cancel/return as per the cancellation/return policies of the product mentioned on the product page.

Question: I have received an SMS / Email notification for a Flipkart EMI order that I haven't placed. What should I do?
Answer: Please cancel your order immediately by visiting 'Orders' and choosing the item you wish to cancel. Please change your password, and contact our customer support for securing your account. Please raise a support ticket through Flipkart ‘Help Centre’ immediately at https://www.flipkart.com/helpcentre.

Question: How will Flipkart EMI bill be generated?
Answer: You will get a single, unified bill that will contain your Flipkart EMI dues. The total amount due will be calculated on the 1st of the subsequent month and will be payable by the 5th of the same month.

Question: How will I know that my Flipkart EMI bill has been generated?
Answer: You will receive Email / SMS / app notifications about the amount due and a payment link on the 1st of the calendar month.

Question: What will happen to my Flipkart EMI dues once EMI transactions are discontinued?
Answer: Your past EMIs will continue to get added in the subsequent bills as per their schedule. To continue using Flipkart EMI services, please repay all your remaining EMI dues.

Question: How do I pay Flipkart EMI bill?
Answer:
You can pay your bill by clicking on the payment link received along with the Email/SMS notification sent to you by Flipkart.
You can also view your bill and make the payment from the ‘Flipkart EMI’ section under 'Account' on the Flipkart website, mobile site, Android, or iOS app.

Question: What payment modes are supported to pay the Flipkart EMI bill?
Answer: We currently support bill payment for Flipkart EMI through UPI/Debit Card.

Question: Can I pay the bill using Cash / EMIs / credit card?
Answer: No, we do not support payment of bills using cash / EMIs / credit cards.

Question: Can I change the delivery time for my order?
Answer: Delivery time for an order cannot be changed as of now.

Question: Can I pay only a part of the bill?
Answer: Yes! August 2023 onwards, customers who are delinquent on Flipkart will be allowed to clear off their dues by paying the overdue amount partially.

Question: How much amount can I pay if I am making a partial payment?
Answer: You can pay any amount starting from the minimum due amount to the total overdue amount. The minimum overdue amount is calculated depending on your overdue amount and delinquency status.

Question: Will my bureau be affected if I make partial payments?
Answer: Partial payments let you gradually clear your dues. Paying off the full amount of your oldest pending dues helps reduce your delinquency status.

Question: Can I pay for my unbilled transactions of Flipkart EMI?
Answer: Yes, you can pay for the unbilled transactions at any time during the month.

Question: Can I change the bill date or due date?
Answer: No, we don't support changes to the bill date or due date at this time. The bills will continue to be generated on the 1st of the month, with the 5th as the due date.

Question: I missed the Email/SMS notification sent to me at the time of bill generation. Will I be reminded again?
Answer: Don’t worry. In case you missed the first communication, we will send you multiple reminders before the due date so that you have sufficient time to clear your dues. Alternatively, You can always visit the ‘Accounts’ section on your Flipkart app and click ‘Pay Now’ in the Flipkart EMI section in order to clear your dues.

Question: What happens if I don't pay my bill by the due date?
Answer:
Your Cibil score will be impacted if you do not pay your bills on time. Apart from that, a penalty of 3% of the outstanding due is levied on a monthly basis. The penalty will be calculated on the outstanding due as on the 5th of the month.
Charges are inclusive of applicable taxes
Please note that this might change in the future which will be duly communicated to you.

Question: What happens if I don't pay my bill even after multiple reminders for my Flipkart EMI account?
Answer: Outstanding dues beyond the 5th of the month will incur late payment charges. Continued delays may result in deactivation of your Flipkart EMI account, suspension of purchases, and legal action by our Financing Partner. Non-payment will also be reported to credit bureaus, impacting your future borrowing ability. Please ensure timely payments to avoid these consequences.

Question: What is EMI foreclosure?
Answer: Foreclosure option enables you to close the loan early by paying the complete foreclosure amount. Once the complete payment of foreclosure amount is done, the loan is closed.

Question: Can I foreclose my EMI loan?
Answer: Yes, you can foreclose your Flipkart EMI loan by clicking https://partner.idfcfirstbank.com/quickpayfc/Login.aspx . Payment updates take up to 3 working days, the loan closes within 15 working days, and credit records update within 10 working days after closure.

Question: Is there any charge for Flipkart EMI foreclosure?
Answer: A foreclosure charge of 3.39% of the unbilled principal outstanding amount will apply, exclusive of GST. These charges may change based on lender pricing policy and T&Cs, and any updates will be communicated to you.

Question: How can I foreclose my EMI loans?
Answer: You can foreclose your Flipkart EMI loans by clicking https://partner.idfcfirstbank.com/quickpayfc/Login.aspx . Payment updates take up to 3 working days, the loan closes within 15 working days, and credit records update within 10 working days after closure.

Question: What happens if I cancel the order after foreclosing Flipkart EMI loan?
Answer: You can reach out to the customer support of the lender for the refund of the amount in such scenarios.

Question: How long will it take to Foreclose my loan?
Answer: It may take up to 15 working days to process the request. However, in some cases it may take longer.

Question: How is the foreclosure amount calculated?
Answer: The lender calculates foreclosure amount based on your principal outstanding, proportionate interest rate, and any fees/charges etc. as applicable. This will be inclusive of GST.

Question: How can I request my Flipkart EMI account closure?
Answer: You can do so by clicking here. To close your Flipkart EMI account, ensure there are no outstanding dues. Payment updates take up to 3 working days, the loan closes within 15 working days post-payment, and credit bureau records update within 10 working days after closure.

Question: My payment using the Flipkart EMI did not go through, but the amount has been deducted from my pre-qualified loan offer. What should I do?
Answer: The amount will be automatically adjusted back to your pre-qualified loan offer on the same working day. Please contact us if it is not credited even after 24 hours.

Question: I paid for my Flipkart order using Flipkart EMI but canceled the same later on. How will my pre-qualified/amount be impacted?
Answer:
Your pre-qualified loan offer will be restored in case of a cancellation or return. Your pending EMI dues will be adjusted with the refunded amount and the same will get reflected in your bill.
However, please note that there will be no refund to your bank account given the payment was deducted using your Flipkart EMI loan amount only.

Question: Once a bill is generated, how can I get the refund for an item that I have paid using Flipkart EMI?
Answer: Once your refund has been processed successfully, your due amount will be automatically updated if you haven't paid the bill already. After that, you will need to pay the only adjusted due amount.

Question: What happens to any refund for orders placed using Flipkart EMI, if I have already paid my bill?
Answer: If the bill has already been paid, any refund amount will be credited back to the payment mode used for bill payment, subjected to the product's return and cancelation policy and the normal refund timelines. In case you have already paid an EMI installment, the excess amount collected will be refunded to your bank account.

Question: I placed a return request, but the same was pending approval when my Flipkart EMI bill got generated. What should I do now?
Answer: Please pay the total bill amount before the due date. When your return request is approved by the respective seller, a refund will be initiated to the payment mode used to pay the bill. Penalty charges, if any, will not be refunded or adjusted. Hence, we request you to clear your dues on time.

Question: What is a Processing Fee?
Answer: A Processing Fee is a nominal one time fee which is levied by the Financing Partner towards each Flipkart EMI loan, to cover the sanctioning and processing of the loan. Details of Processing Fees will be contained in your monthly statement.

Question: How is processing fee calculated for Flipkart EMI?
Answer: A fee of 1.25% + GST (no minimum cap) will be applicable on EMI tenures of 2 or 3 months. A processing fee of 1.5% + GST (no minimum cap) will be applicable on a 6-month EMI tenure. A processing fee of 2% + GST (no minimum cap) will be applicable on EMI tenures of 9 or 12 months. This fee will be levied on each EMI transaction and will be visible in your subsequent bill. The processing fee is exclusive of applicable taxes and will be effective from 15th Nov ‘24.

Question: Will the Processing fee be refunded if I cancel/return some items after paying the bill?
Answer: No, the Processing Fee will not be refunded post-purchase on partial cancellation. The fee will only be refunded in the event of a complete cancellation of all the items in the cart.

Question: Why is my Flipkart EMI account blocked?
Answer:
Your Flipkart EMI account can be blocked due to multiple reasons:
Your KYC has expired. Please visit the Flipkart EMI section under 'Accounts' on your Flipkart app. Click on the 'KYC status' section to know your KYC expiry date.
You have overdue payments or your repayment was post 30 days past due date
Due to breach of Flipkart Advanz’s T&C
Due to breach of lending partner’s T&C
Due to internal Flipkart policies
Due to our lending partner's internal policies

Question: Will the Flipkart EMI option reflect as a loan in my credit history or credit report?
Answer: Flipkart EMI will reflect in your credit history/report as a loan for the amount assigned to you. The loan period will reflect a tenure of 3/6/9/12 months, as sanctioned by our financing partner.

Question: What is the cooling off period?
Answer: A cooling-off/look-up period is the time window that allows you to exit EMI loans without any penalty. It is currently 3 days from the date of the transaction, but this is subject to the policy and T&Cs.

Question: How do I withdraw my consent for sharing my credit information?
Answer: You can withdraw your consent by contacting us through the 'Orders' section of our app. Please note that once you withdraw your consent, you will not be able to use your Flipkart EMI anymore. You will be asked to clear your pending dues (if any) post which your account will be closed.

Question: How do I close my Flipkart EMI account?
Answer:
In case you want to close your Flipkart EMI account, you can do so by contacting us through our Help Centre: https://www.flipkart.com/helpcentre.
Our Financing Partner will also mark the account as closed post-settlement of all outstanding dues.
For more information regarding Flipkart EMI, please visit the terms and conditions at https://www.flipkart.com/pages/advanz-service-tnc.

Question: How does Flipkart prevent card fraud?
Answer: Online payments are monitored by our systems for any suspicious activity and some transactions are verified through extensive checks if we find that they are not authorised by the owner of the card. When we're not able to rule fraud out in rare cases, the transaction is kept on hold and we ask the shopper to share relevant proofs. This is done to make sure that the transaction is genuine and authorised.

Question: Can I use any Debit Card to pay for my order?
Answer: You can choose to pay for your order on Flipkart with any Visa, MasterCard or Maestro Debit Card.

Question: Can I use the Cash on Delivery payment option for every product I buy on Flipkart?
Answer:
The availability of Cash on Delivery option depends on factors like the delivery pincode, type of products etc.
Please enter your pincode on the product page to check if CoD is available at your location. If this option is available for your pincode, you can shop for products up to ₹49,999 using this.

Question: How can I get the 3D Secure password for my Credit/Debit Card?
Answer: You can get a 3D Secure password by registering your Credit/Debit Card on your bank's website.

Question: How can I pay with a saved Credit/Debit Card?
Answer: Your saved cards can be seen when you choose the credit or debit card option to pay for your order. Enter the CVV number of that card (we do not store it) and click on the 'Pay' button. You'll also have to enter the card's 3D Secure password to complete the transaction.

Question: How does the 3D Secure password add security to my online transactions?
Answer: The 3D Secure password is something that only you would know, ensuring no one else can use your card to shop online.

Question: If I have a saved card on Flipkart, will I be able to use a new card for my next payment?
Answer: Yes. Even if you've saved your card details on Flipkart, you always have the option to use any other credit/debit card to pay.

Question: What is a 3D Secure password?
Answer: A 3D Secure password adds an extra layer of security through identity verification for your online Credit & Debit card transactions (VISA & MasterCard).

Question: What is the amount I can shop for with Cash on Delivery payment option?
Answer: You can shop up to Rs. 49,999 using Cash on Delivery (CoD) option.

Question: Why is my card being saved on Flipkart?
Answer: It's quicker. You can save the hassle of typing in the complete card information every time you shop on Flipkart by saving your card details. You can make your payment by selecting the saved card of your choice at checkout. While this is obviously faster, it is also very secure.

Question: What all card information does Flipkart store?
Answer: We only store your card number, cardholder name and card expiry date. We do not store your card's CVV number or the 3D secure password. Question: Can I delete my saved cards?
Answer: Yes, you can delete your saved cards at any given time.

Question: How many cards can I save on Flipkart?
Answer: As of now, you can save upto 10 cards using the 'Save Card' option.

Question: What cards can I save on Flipkart?
Answer: You can save any credit or debit VISA, MasterCard, Maestro or American Express card issued by a bank in India.

Question: How do I save my card(s) on Flipkart?
Answer: Your card is saved automatically when you make a successful payment by entering the card details while purchasing on Flipkart. Alternatively, you can also save your card by navigating to 'My Accounts > Payments > My Saved Cards'. To save the card you'll need the card number and the expiry date. You can also add a card label to better identify a saved card.

Question: How do I make a payment using a saved card?
Answer: You can view your saved cards by selecting the credit/debit card payment option at checkout. Select a saved card that you wish to use to make the payment. Enter the CVV number of that card (we do not store it) and click the 'Pay' button to initiate your payment. You will also have to enter the card's 3D Secure password to complete the transaction.

Question: If I have a saved card on Flipkart, will I be able to use a new card for my next payment?
Answer: Yes. Even if you have saved your card on Flipkart, you always have the option to use any other credit/debit card for making a payment.

Question: How can I delete my saved card?
Answer: You can delete your saved card information on Flipkart from the 'My Account' section. Go to 'My Account > Payments > My Saved Cards' and you will be able to see your saved card(s). You can then click on 'Remove this card'.

Question: What are the pre-requisites for using the saved card feature?
Answer: You should have a registered account with Flipkart to which you should be logged in. Due to security reasons, this feature is not available during guest checkout.

Question: Can I use a saved card to make an EMI payment?
Answer: Yes, if your saved credit card is eligible for your Bank's EMI program then you can use it for making an EMI payment.

Question: I typed an incorrect card number by mistake when adding my card. How do I correct it?
Answer: If you typed an incorrect card number, name or card expiry date, you need to first delete the entered details by clicking on "Remove this card" and then add the card again with the correct details.

Question: Can I use my saved cards for making a payment on Flipkart's mobile site/app?
Answer: Absolutely! Any cards that you save on Flipkart's website can be used on Flipkart app and mobile site as well. You can also save cards through your mobile and use them on Flipkart's website.

Question: What if I do not want my cards to be imported?
Answer: You can manage these cards from the 'Saved Cards' section on PhonePe or Flipkart. If you wish to delete a card from both PhonePe and Flipkart, you need to perform this operation independently in both the applications.

Question: Can I use Credit/Debit Card to pay on Flipkart through the Flipkart app?
Answer: Yes, you can use your Debit/Credit Card to shop on our mobile app, website, and mobile site too!

Question: Can I combine the balance on my Gift Cards with Cash on Delivery to pay for an order?
Answer: Cash on Delivery payments cannot be combined with other payments modes.

Question: I tried to make the payment for my Cash on Delivery order using 'pay now', but the payment failed, what should I do?
Answer: Any amount debited will be credited back to the original source of payment within 8 business days. You can pay with cash/card/UPI for your order at the time of delivery.

Question: How can I convert my Cash on delivery order to a prepaid?
Answer:
On your app, check if you are getting the 'Pay Now' option for the desired order. If the option is available, tap it and proceed with the payment. Once the payment is successful, an OTP will be sent to you via SMS.
  You can also view this OTP against the order in the 'Orders' section until the product gets delivered. You will need to share this OTP with the delivery executive during delivery and collect the product.

Question: I have updated my payment mode for my order but have not received the OTP.
Answer: On your app, go to the 'Orders' page and you will see an OTP next to your order. Please share the same with the delivery executive.

Question: My amount is debited twice for the order, what should I do?
Answer: If the order value is debited twice from your account, you can rest assured that the respective bank will ensure a refund is reflected in your account within eight business days. In case you do not receive a refund within this timeline, please contact the bank for assistance.

Question: How can I pay for my order?

You can choose to conveniently pay for your order using any of the following methods:
Cash on Delivery
Net Banking
Gift Card / Wallet
Visa, MasterCard, Maestro and American Express Credit or Debit cards issued in India and 21 other countries.
To know more about payments, click here: http://www.flipkart.com/s/help/payments

Question: How do I pay using a credit or debit card?
Answer: You can choose the credit card or debit card payment option during the checkout process of your purchase. For a seamless payment process, please keep your card number, expiration date, and three-digit CVV number handy, which can be found on your card and enter them when requested.

Question: My amount has been debited but order has not been confirmed, what should I do?
Answer: It may take up to 2 hours for your order confirmation message to arrive via email or SMS. If the order-related transaction is unsuccessful, you will get a refund confirmation and the amount will be credited to the payment source within 8 business days.

Question: Can I cancel my EMI after I've placed the order using the Bajaj Finserv payment option?
Answer:
Since payment modes cannot be changed after an order is placed, to cancel your EMI, your order will need to be cancelled.
*Certain items cannot be cancelled after 24 hours of placing the order.

Question: Do I need to make a down payment to buy an item using the Bajaj Finserv EMI payment mode?
Answer: No, a down payment is not required for buying an item using the Bajaj Finserv EMI option.

Question: I chose the wrong EMI plan while making the payment using Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI option. Can I change it now?
Answer:
EMI plan chosen while paying through the Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI payment option cannot be changed once the order has been placed. If your order hasn't been delivered yet, you can cancel it and place a new order with the preferred EMI plan.
Certain items cannot be cancelled after 24 hours of placing the order."

Question: Why can't I see Bajaj Finserv as a payment mode for some items?
Answer: Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI payment mode is available for select items with certain sellers. Please check the product page of the item you'd like to shop for on our app to see if the option is available.

Question: Is Bajaj Finserv payment mode available on both the website and app?
Answer: Yes, the Bajaj Finserv payment mode is available both on the Flipkart app and website.

Question: I did not get the OTP while I was paying through the 'Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI' payment mode. What should I do?
Answer: Please contact Bajaj Finserv at 08698010101 for support.

Question: If I have paid for my order using the Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI payment option, will I get a complete refund if the item is cancelled or returned?
Answer:
Yes, you will get a complete refund to the extent of the EMIs paid by you (if any) for the item in case it is canceled or returned. However, any amount charged as a penalty by Bajaj Finserv for the remaining EMIs cannot be refunded.
  You may reach Bajaj Finserv at 08698010101 for more details.

Question: My payment from the 'Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI' payment mode did not go through, but the amount has been blocked on my card. What should I do?
Answer: Please contact Bajaj Finserv at 08698010101 for support.

Question: How can I foreclose my EMI with Bajaj Finserv?
Answer: You can contact Bajaj Finserv at 08698010101 for help with the foreclosure of your EMI with them.

Question: How can I pay for my order using the Bajaj Finserv payment mode?
Answer:

Please note, the Bajaj Finserv EMI option will not be available if your cart contains more than 1 item.

Question: What are the EMI plans available if I pay using the Bajaj Finserv payment mode?
Answer: Available EMI plans can be checked by clicking 'No Cost EMI' on the Bajaj Finserv EMI Network Card below the listed price of the item on the product page.

Question: What is the credit limit on the Bajaj Finserv EMI Network card for shopping on Flipkart?
Answer:
The credit limit varies based on the type of Bajaj Finserv EMI Network Card you hold.
For more details, please check Bajaj Finserv support FAQs here: https://www.bajajfinserv.in/insta-emi-card
You can also contact Bajaj Finserv at 08698010101 for support.

Question: What is Bajaj Finserv payment mode?
Answer: Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI' is a payment option on Flipkart exclusively for Bajaj Finserv EMI Network Card holders. This option enables you to pay for select items listed by specific sellers, with an EMI plan of your choice without any interest. The monthly installments are deducted by Bajaj Finserv from the bank account linked to your Bajaj Finserv EMI Network Card.

Question: How can I get a Bajaj Finserv EMI Network card?
Answer: You can check the eligibility and process of getting a Bajaj Finserv No Cost EMI card on their website: www.bajajfinserv.in/finance

Question: What is the difference between Bajaj Finserv EMI and Credit Card No Cost EMI?
Answer: If you make a payment using a Bajaj Finserv EMI card, no interest will be levied on the transaction amount. Alternatively, if you pay through a credit card that is eligible for No Cost EMI, a discount equivalent to the interest amount that you would have paid to the bank will be granted to you at the time of payment. Question: What are the checks done for an item that I'm returning?

Complete Product
All in-the-box accessories (like remote control, starter kits, instruction manuals, chargers, headphones, etc.), freebies and combos (if any) should be present.
Unused Product
The product should be unused, unwashed, unsoiled, without any stains and with non-tampered quality check seals/ warranty seals (wherever applicable). Before returning a Mobile/ Laptop/ Tablet, the device should be formatted and Screen Lock (Pin, Pattern or Fingerprint) must be disabled. iCloud lock must be disabled and iCloud deactivation done for Apple devices.
Undamaged Product
The product (including SIM trays/ charging port/ headphone port, back-panel etc.) should be undamaged and without any scratches, dents, tears or holes.
Undamaged Packaging
Product's original packaging/ box should be undamaged.

Question: What is a Personal Loan on Flipkart?
Answer: It is an option using which you can get direct cash transfer into your savings account. Personal loan can be used to fund any expense including marriage, education, home renovation, travel, medical needs as well as manage day to day expenses etc.

Question: Is there any collateral/security to be provided for availing Personal Loan?
Answer: No there is no need of any collateral or security to avail the personal loan.

Question: What is the tenure for which I can avail a Personal Loan?
Answer: Personal loan on Flipkart has a flexible tenure ranging from 6 months to 36 months. For Axis bank customers, there are options from 6 to 36 months whereas for non-Axis bank customers the tenures range from 12 to 60 months.

Question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Personal loan on Flipkart?
Answer: Eligibility for the personal loan will be decided by Axis Bank basis various factors including a fixed monthly income, age, nature of employment, CIBIL score, professional experience etc.

Question: What is E-NACH? For how long is my E-NACH valid?
Answer: E-NACH stands for Electronic National Automated Clearing House. This enables recurring payments made towards Financial Institutions like NBFCs/Banks from customers towards repayments. The amount gets withdrawn for months depending on the EMI repayment tenure selected.

Question: Can I change the repayment date of my Personal loan?
Answer: No, there is no option to change the EMI repayment date of your personal loan.

Question: What do I do when my bank is not appearing in the list of banks for E-NACH?
Answer: E-NACH is mandatory for completing the registration process as part of the personal loan on Flipkart. In case your bank is not listed you can choose an alternate bank account from the available options.

Question: Personal Loan on Flipkart is powered by which lender?
Answer: Axis Bank Pvt Ltd is the lending partner for Personal Loan on Flipkart.

Question: What is the minimum and maximum amount for Personal Loan on Flipkart?

Question: How much time does it take for Personal loan to be disbursed?

Question: How can I recharge my Mobile Prepaid number on Flipkart?

Question: Why am I unable recharge my mobile number on Flipkart?

Question: Amount has been debited from my account and my mobile recharge has failed. What will happen to the money I paid?

Question: If I recharge for a wrong number, can I cancel the order?

Question: I have recharged my number twice. What should I do?
Answer: In case of a duplicate recharge, kindly reach out to your mobile network operator for further help on this.

Question: What are the payment options available for recharge?

Question: What happens if my account is debited and my mobile recharge is in pending state?

Question: What is the type of bike insurance available on Flipkart?
Answer: Comprehensive insurance that covers both third-party vehicles and one's own vehicle in an accident is available on Flipkart.

Question: Is bike insurance mandatory for all two-wheelers?

Question: Can I choose to have only own damage cover for bike insurance?

Question: Can I select my preferred Insured Declared Value (IDV)?

Question: What factors do you consider when calculating my insurance premium?
Answer: The insurance premium is determined by various factors such as the Insured Declared Value (IDV), brand, model, variant combination, and other relevant details.

Question: Can I get tax exemption on two-wheeler insurance?

Question: How do I obtain the insurance policy document?

Question: What is the procedure for renewing my insurance?

- Third Party Liability : Financial / Legal losses due to damage to any third-party person

- Active insurance policy document
- RC book
- Active Driving License
- First Information Report (FIR) as filed with the local Police
- Photos clicked at the time of accident

Supporting documents like repair bills, dispatch invoice from service center etc would be required in case of reimbursement claims.

Question: Can I change the insurance company in between? If yes, how?
Answer:
Yes, you have the option to change the insurance company once selected under certain conditions.
Since two-wheeler insurance is non transferable, you must cancel the existing policy and avail a new one. Please note that the existing insurance policy cannot be canceled if there were claims made during this time period.

Please keep the below pointers in mind while opting to change the insurance company:

- Minimum 7 days notice to be provided in writing to the existing insurer. In the interim, you can sign up with the desired insurer for a new policy.
- Once the cover is issued by the new insurance company, you must provide documentary evidence to cancel the previous insurance
- If all conditions are satisfied, the premium amount will be refunded after deductions made on a prorated basis.

Here are a few things to consider before changing the insurance policy:

- If you would like to change the insurance company due to the high premium amount, compare the benefits of the existing cover versus the new one. Paying a few hundred less for lesser benefits may not be feasible.
- Analyze factors such as the efficiency of customer service, availability of online tools and resources, claim settlement ratio and other factors that affect you directly.

Question: Can I transfer the insurance to the new owner if I sell my two wheeler?

- Fill the form and submit it to the RTO along with any relevant documents (if any)
- Take the Clearance Certificate from the RTO for the submitted forms and the proof of the sale
- Submit all relevant documents to the insurance company
- Pay the required fee (if any).
- Receive the policy bearing their name in an email or through the courier

Question: How long will it take to issue the policy document?

Question: How can I update details on the insurance policy after it has been issued?

Question: How long will it take to approve and process an insurance claim by Acko?
Answer: The timeline for completion will vary depending on individual circumstances. Upon receiving all necessary documentation, Acko's team will conduct a survey to assess the situation. Question: What is UPI on Flipkart?
Answer: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) on Flipkart is a payment system facilitated through a Third Party Application Provider (TPAP). It leverages an UPI-compliant app developed by Flipkart to enable seamless transactions based on the UPI framework. This system allows instant money transfers between two bank accounts, utilizing the National Payments Corporation of India's (NPCI) regulated platform, which is built over the IMPS infrastructure.

Question: What is a Flipkart UPI PIN?
Answer: A UPI PIN which is also know as Unified Payments Interface Personal Identification Number is a secure 4 to 6 digit passcode that you set when registering on this app for the first time. It's required to authorize any bank transactions. Kindly note that the Flipkart UPI-PIN is different from the ATM /Debit Card PIN issued by banks. Please generate a new UPI-PIN within the Flipkart UPI app. Keep your UPI-PIN confidential. Flipkart UPI doesn't store or access this information. Also, remember that your bank's customer support will never ask for your UPI-PIN.

Question: Can I use Flipkart UPI for transactions other than those on Flipkart?
Answer: Yes, you can use Flipkart UPI to make payments at various merchants using 'Scan & Pay QR', on merchant apps, or by sending money through UPI IDs or phone numbers.

Question: Can I add my bank account to someone else's Flipkart account?
Answer: No, for security reasons, the phone number linked to both the Flipkart account and the bank account must be the same.

Question: Can I log in to my Flipkart account on my friend’s phone and make a Flipkart UPI transactions?
Answer: No, for security reasons, you can only perform Flipkart UPI transactions from the device that has the SIM card associated with the phone number linked to your bank account.

Question: How can I make my first UPI payment using Flipkart UPI?
Answer:
To make your first UPI payment using Flipkart UPI, follow these steps:

First add a bank account by following these steps.

1. Log in to your Flipkart App
2. Tap on the 'Scan & Pay' icon available on the Flipkart Home page
3. Select 'My UPI' at the bottom and then tap on 'Add bank'
4. Choose the SIM card linked to your bank account and select your bank
5. Ensure your registered mobile number has enough balance to send a verification SMS
6. Allow SMS permissions when prompted for verification
7. Set Your UPI PIN

Once your bank account is added, and UPI PIN is set, you're ready to make transactions.

Use the 'Scan and Pay' option to scan a QR code for UPI payment.

Alternatively, click on 'Send Money,' select the contact or UPI ID, enter the amount, and tap Pay.

Question: Can I use my existing UPI PIN from another UPI app on Flipkart?
Answer:
Yes, if you already have a UPI PIN from another UPI app, you can use the same PIN.

If you're setting up UPI for the first time, follow these steps:

1. Enter your debit/ATM card details
2. Input the 6-digit OTP received via SMS on your registered mobile number
3. Enter the ATM PIN for your Debit/ATM card
4. Set a new 4 or 6 digit UPI PIN and confirm it
5. Make a Payment or Send Money

Question: Can I transfer money using Flipkart UPI to my friends/family?
Answer:
Yes, you can make a payment or send money using Flipkart UPI by following these simple steps:

Add your bank account and set your secret UPI PIN you need to tap on Money+ section available on the Flipkart homepage.

If you wish to make a Payment with 'Scan & Pay' option:
- Tap on the 'Scan and Pay' option on Flipkart UPI
- Use your phone's camera to scan the QR code of the recipient
- Enter the amount and complete the payment

If you're sending Money to a Contact or UPI ID:
- Click on the 'Send Money' option at the bottom of the screen
- Choose a contact or enter the UPI ID of the recipient
- Enter the amount and complete the payment

Question: How can I check my bank balance?
Answer:
You can easily check your bank balance with these simple steps:

1. Log in to your Flipkart app
2. Tap 'Scan & Pay' option
3. Select the 'My UPI' option
4. Tap 'Payment Methods' and select the bank account for which you want to check the balance
5. Enter your MPIN and check your bank balance

Remember to keep your UPI MPIN confidential and avoid sharing it with anyone.

Question: My bank is not listed on Flipkart UPI. What should I do?
Answer: If your bank is not listed on Flipkart UPI, you won't be able to add that particular bank account for UPI transactions. You can reach out to your bank for further details and assistance.

Question: How can I reset my Flipkart UPI PIN?
Answer:
You can reset your Flipkart UPI PIN by following these simple steps:

- Log in to your Flipkart app.

- Tap 'Scan & Pay' option on Flipkart Homepage & select 'My UPI' option available at the bottom.

- Select 'Payment Methods' and choose the bank account for which you want to change the UPI PIN.

- Tap 'Change PIN/Forgot PIN' and enter your Debit/ATM card details for that account.

- Enter the 6-digit OTP received via SMS on your registered mobile number. Please note, if you've granted SMS permissions, Flipkart will automatically fetch the OTP.

- Enter the 4-digit ATM PIN of your Debit/ATM card and set a new 4 or 6 digit UPI PIN for the account.

- Confirm the new PIN by entering it again and tap 'Confirm' to complete the process.

Question: How do I keep my Flipkart UPI account secure?

Question: I have made a payment using Flipkart UPI but it is shown as pending. What should I do?
Answer:
Please wait for up to 5 minutes for your transaction to reach a success or failure state and then recheck the latest transaction status.

If a transaction is still pending after 5 minutes, follow these steps:

Question: What should I do in case Flipkart UPI transaction was successful but the receiver doesn't get the money even after 5 days?

Question: What is the User Dispute Redressal Mechanism (UDIR)?
Answer: The User Dispute Redressal Mechanism (UDIR) is a system facilitated by NPCI, allowing users to lodge complaints related to their transactions on any UPI App.

Question: Can I raise a UDIR If my payment is successful and the receiver doesn't receive the money?

Your dues will be auto-deducted from your available balance on the 5th of each month. You’ll receive a bill via Email/SMS.
Any unused balance will still show in your superPay limit.

Question: Can I cancel or return my order placed using superPay Later?
Answer: Yes, you can cancel or request a return for an order as per the product's cancellation or returns policy. that you placed using the superPay Later.

Question: What happens to my superPay Later limit after cancellation or return?
Answer: If the refund is processed before the bill is generated (1st of the next month), it will be adjusted against the due amount. If the refund happens after the bill is generated, it will be credited to your linked superPay Later bank account.

Question: When will I get the refund for a cancelled or returned order?
Answer: Refunds processed before the 1st of the next month will be adjusted in your reserved amount. Refunds after the 1st will be credited to your linked bank account within 48 hours.

Question: What is superPay in 3?
Answer:
superPay in 3 is a convenient way for select customers to split their purchase amount into three equal parts.

 During purchase, you pay for one part and the remaining 2 parts by the 5th of the upcoming months.

Question: How does superPay in 3 work?
Answer:
Once you're eligible for superPay in 3, you'll be assigned a shopping balance that you can use to place select orders on Flipkart. This balance reduces when you place an order and pay the first part, and it refreshes as you repay the remaining parts.
Shopping Balance - Rs 45000
Product Amount - Rs 15000
1st part- Rs 5000/- (To be paid by the customer  while placing the order )
2nd part- Rs 5000/- (To be paid by 5th of the next month)
3rd part- Rs 5000/-(To be paid by 5th of the next to next month)
Your remaining balance becomes Rs 30,000.

Question: What are the benefits of superPay in 3?
Answer:
superPay in 3 makes shopping easier by letting you split your payment into three interest-free parts without any extra cost. It’s quick, hassle-free, and helps you manage your budget better.
You’ll get a clear monthly statement with no hidden charges, giving you full control over your payments. It's a smart, flexible way to shop now and pay later.

Question: Who is eligible to use superPay in 3?
Answer:
superPay in 3 is currently available to select customers. If the option is visible to you at checkout, you can go ahead and use it. Please note that your cart value must be greater than Rs 1,500. 
We’re gradually rolling it out and hope to make it available to more users soon.

Question: How can I get onboarded to superPay in 3?

Steps to activate superPay in 3 if Flipkart UPI is enabled:

Step 2:Click on ‘superPay’
Step 3:Select ‘superPay in 3’

Step 5:Choose your bank account

Your superPay in 3 will be activated instantly.

Question: How can I place an order using superPay in 3 on Flipkart?

Question: How does the superPay in 3 billing cycle work?
Answer:
superPay in 3 follows a fixed billing cycle that runs from the 21st of the current month to the 20th of the next month. Your statement is generated on the 1st of every month, and the due date to make the payment is the 5th of that month.
For example,
Product Amount - Rs 15000
Date of order placement - 16th Jan, 2025 (order placed before billing cycle)
1st part- Rs 5000 (To be paid by the customer on 16th Jan, 2025 while placing the order )
2nd part- Rs 5000 (Will be billed on 1st Feb, 2025 and to be paid by 5th Feb, since the order was placed before 21st Jan)
3rd part- Rs 5000 (Will be billed on 1st Mar, 2025 and to be paid by 5th Mar)
Whereas if,
Date of order placement - 21st Jan, 2025 (order placed after billing cycle)
1st part - Rs 5000 (To be paid by the customer on 21st Jan, 2025 while placing the order )
2nd part- Rs 5000 (Will be billed on 1st Mar, 2025 and to be paid by 5th Mar, since the order was placed after 20th Jan)
3rd part - Rs 5000 (Will be billed on 1st Apr, 2025 and to be paid by 5th Apr
So, your payment dates depend on when you make the purchase.

Question: How does my shopping balance refresh for superPay in 3?
Answer: Your shopping balance refreshes automatically as you repay . Each time a repayment is completed, whether through UPI Autopay or manual paylink, the same amount is added back to your available balance.

Question: How do I increase my superPay in 3 balance?
Answer: Your shopping balance may be raised automatically over time based on your usage and timely payments.

Question: What is the validity of the superPay in 3 shopping balance?
Answer: Your shopping balance does not have a fixed expiry date. It stays active as long as your account is in good standing and there are no defaults on repayments. The balance refreshes automatically; each time you repay, the equivalent amount gets added back to your available balance.

Question: Can superPay in 3 be combined with other payment methods?
Answer: superPay in 3 can be clubbed only with SuperCoins or Flipkart Gift Card. It cannot be used with Cash on Delivery (COD) or other payment methods.

Question: Do I need to change the bank account linked with superPay in 3 for every order?

Question: Can I cancel or return my order after placing it using this payment option?

Question: How will the statement be generated for superPay in 3?
Answer: A single, consolidated statement will be generated for all your superPay in 3 transactions. The total amount due will be calculated on the 1st of every month and auto-debited via UPI Autopay by the 5th.

Question: How will I know that my statement has been generated?
Answer: You will receive a notification via Email, SMS, or the Flipkart app on the 1st of the month with details of your amount due.

Question: How will I know the due date of the superPay in 3 statement?
Answer: You can check the due date from the 'My Account' or 'Flipkart Pay' section of the Flipkart app. The due date is the 5th of every month.

Question: How do I pay my superPay in 3 statement?
Answer: Your 2nd and 3rd payments will be auto-deducted from your bank account linked to Flipkart UPI via autopay on the 5th of the month. Make sure your account has a sufficient balance before the due date. If Autopay fails, you can view your statement and pay manually through the ‘superPay in 3’ section under 'My Account' on the Flipkart app.

Question: What payment modes are supported to pay the superPay in 3 statement?
Answer: Currently, payments can be made only through Flipkart UPI.

Question: Can I pay using cash, credit/debit cards, EMI, or net banking?
Answer: No, currently payments using cash, EMIs, credit/debit cards, or net banking are not supported. Payments can be made only using Flipkart UPI.

Question: Can I pay the due amount during the delivery of the order?
Answer: No, the statement must be paid only by using the supported method that is Flipkart UPI.

Question: Can I pay just a part of the bill?
Answer: No, partial payments are not allowed.

Question: Can I change the statement date or due date?
Answer: No, the statement will always be generated on the 1st of each month, with the due date fixed on the 5th. These dates cannot be changed.

Question: What if I don’t pay even after multiple reminders?
Answer: Even after multiple reminders, non-payment on due date may lead to deactivation of the superPay-in-3 account and suspension of any further purchases on www.flipkart.com, Flipkart Mobile apps, Flipkart mobile site, and any other merchants. Our seller partner may also take legal action against the customers who don’t pay on time.

Question: What should I do if the auto-debit fails?
Answer: If auto-debit fails, you can pay manually by selecting the ‘Pay Now’ option under the superPay in 3 section in ‘My Accounts’ on the Flipkart app.

Question: Can I repay my superPay in 3 bill?
Answer: Yes, you can pay the upcoming payment early or make a complete payment for the entire order at once from the superPay in 3 section on the app. Once paid, the corresponding autopay debit will be cancelled.

Question: My order using superPay in 3 didn’t go through, but the amount was deducted. What should I do?
Answer:
If your order is still in ‘Pending’ status, please wait for up to 2 hours. Your bank will confirm the payment status during this time.
-If successful, your order will be processed.
-If not, a refund will be initiated within 30 minutes, and your UPI mandate will be cancelled automatically.
Please do not place a new order until the final payment status is confirmed.

Question: What happens if I get a refund for an order placed using superPay in 3?
Answer: If you haven’t paid the monthly due amount yet, the refunded amount will be adjusted automatically, and you’ll only need to pay the updated due. If you’ve already paid the due amount, the refund will be credited to your payment method (usually your bank account). The associated UPI mandates will also be cancelled. The first payment paid during order placement will be refunded to your bank as per standard UPI timelines.

Question: I placed a return request, but it was still pending when my bill was generated. What should I do?
Answer: To avoid missing a payment, ensure to maintain enough balance in your bank account. Once your return is approved, the refund will be processed. Please note that late fee penalties (if any) are not refunded. So, it’s best to clear your dues on time.
